page.title: 04Farming near Landscove
page.content: The cattle are reared for their milk and meat,the sheep for their wool and lambs meat.{Farming }in the area is made more difficult by the steep slopes where it is dangerous to use big machines. {Cider}has been produced since very early times and many of the farmers have a few acres of apple trees. Mr.Savage sends an average of 45 tons to Mr.Hill each year for cider making. {Cereal}production is mostly in the form of barley ,used for animal feed and the malting of beer.Some wheat is grown for bread and baking .The grain not sold here goes abroad through the{grain}terminal at Teignmouth or Exmouth. There are 14 farms here which mostly belong to the Church Commissioners.
